subject: Politics
title: Lobbying and Legal Corruption
description: A quick win: understand Lobbying and Legal Corruption.

hook.text: In the US, lobbyists outnumber members of Congress 20 to 1. Legal corruption is still corruption.

buildup.text: Lobbying means paying professionals to influence legislation. It's legal in most democracies and worth billions.

discovery.text: The pharmaceutical industry spent $356 million lobbying Congress in 2022. Drug prices stayed high. Coincidence?

twist.text: Defenders say lobbying is free speech and provides expertise. Critics say it gives wealthy interests outsized power.

climax.text: The revolving door worsens things. Officials leave government for lobbying jobs, selling their access and networks.

punchline.text: Lobbying is legal bribery with better branding. The result is the same.

quiz.question: What is the 'revolving door' in politics?
options: Officials leaving government for lobbying jobs, selling access and networks
A physical door in the Capitol building
A voting mechanism used in direct democracy
